comments.body:
This is the current version of this library:
https://github.com/atecarlos/protractor-http-mock/blob/77df9c34a6cb837856fdb23e9cfb580a51ea4aec/package.json

Currently the type of each mock and each plug-in is checked separately.
https://github.com/atecarlos/protractor-http-mock/blob/77df9c34a6cb837856fdb23e9cfb580a51ea4aec/lib/initData.js#L47
https://github.com/atecarlos/protractor-http-mock/blob/77df9c34a6cb837856fdb23e9cfb580a51ea4aec/lib/initData.js#L72

 Because of that all 4 overloaded methods got merged into a single one.
As it is shown in the `TestCtorOverloads` test the function can receive mocks of different types, e.g. `Get<number>, Delete<string>`, hence `AllRequests` cannot point at one specific generic type.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +50,54 @@            /**
             * Path to protractor configuration file.
             * Default: protractor-conf.js
             */
            protractorConfig?: string;

comments.body: Just being more specific on which HTTP method should be used in which interface. This is in accordance to documentation put on top of the interfaces.

Each response can be delayed now.
https://github.com/atecarlos/protractor-http-mock/blob/77df9c34a6cb837856fdb23e9cfb580a51ea4aec/lib/httpMock.js#L265
As explained above different types of mocks can be mixed.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +147,151 @@         * All available request types.
         */
        type AllRequests = Get<any> |
            PostData<any, any> |
            Post<any> |
